00037 /**
00038  * \file elemdeath_ex1.c
00039  * \brief Example of using some of the elemdeath module and related calls
00040  *
00041  * \description
00042  *
00043  *   Example of using some of the elemdeath module and related calls.
00044  *   Loops through 4 different cases of dead elements in a 3x3 hex mesh
00045  *   and shows how to find various topological information about the
00046  *   dead element regions wrt the mesh sides.
00047  *
00048  *   The code prints out the side info of the original mesh, and info
00049  *   about 4 different dead region cases.
00050  *
00051  * $Source: /usr/local/Repositories/fcdmf/fclib/examples/elemdeath_ex1.c,v $
00052  * $Revision: 1.27 $
00053  * $Date: 2006/08/30 19:20:00 $
00054  *
00055  *  \todo
00056  *   - may replace this with the sidesDeath code, or that code applied
00057  *     to these meshes
00058  *   - rewrite to take advantage of new calc of sides in shape, once
00059  *     i decide what will happen to thin shape and if there will be a new shape struct
00060  *
00061  *  \modifications
00062  *   - 12/05/2005 ACG created from surfacedemo.c in my sandbox
00063  *   - 01/04/2006 ACG added new methods from shape. Got rid of eval method to
00064  *     clean this up.
00065  *   - 06/04/2006 ACG updated to use new getShapeSides interface
00066  *   - 06/16/2006 ACG cleaned up to use shape and remove thin shape
00067  */
00068 #include "fc.h"
00069 
00070 /**
00071  * \brief - makes dead elements in the mesh
00072  *
00073  * \description
00074  *  makes dead elements in the mesh
00075  */
00076 static void makeDeadVar(
00077  FC_Mesh mesh, /**< input - mesh */
00078  int iteration, /**< input - which iteration this is */
00079  int numelempertype, /**< input - num element in this mesh */
00080  FC_Variable* deadvar /**< output - variable where val of 1 = dead elem */
00081 ){
00082   FC_ReturnCode rc;
00083   int numDataPoint,j;
00084   int *data;
00085  
00086   rc = fc_createVariable(mesh,"deadvar",deadvar);
00087   fc_exitIfErrorPrintf(rc, "failed to create deadvar");
00088     
00089   //now set dead data
00090   numDataPoint = numelempertype;
00091   data = (int*)malloc(numDataPoint*sizeof(int));
00092   switch(iteration){
00093   case 0: //empty set
00094     printf("CASE 0: Empty set. \n");
00095     for (j = 0; j < numDataPoint; j++)
00096       data[j] = 0;
00097     break;
00098   case 1: //complete set
00099     printf("CASE 1: Complete set. \n");
00100     for (j = 0; j < numDataPoint; j++)
00101       data[j] = 1;
00102     break;
00103   case 2:
00104     printf("CASE 2: Bottom along the corner, top across the middle. \n");
00105     for (j = 0; j < numDataPoint; j++)
00106       data[j] = 0;
00107     //known test case
00108     data[0] = 1;
00109     data[1] = 1;
00110     data[2] = 1;
00111     data[7] = 1;
00112     data[16] = 1;
00113     data[25] = 1;
00114     break;
00115   case 3:
00116     printf("CASE 3: Through the middle\n");
00117     for (j = 0; j < numDataPoint; j++)
00118       data[j] = 0;
00119     //known test case
00120     data[4] = 1;
00121     data[13] = 1;
00122     data[22] = 1;
00123     break;
00124   default: //shouldnt occur
00125     break;
00126   }
00127   fflush(NULL);
00128   
00129   //set var data
00130   rc = fc_setVariableData(*deadvar,numDataPoint,1,FC_AT_ELEMENT,
00131                  FC_MT_SCALAR, FC_DT_INT,data);
00132   fc_exitIfErrorPrintf(rc,"failed to set var data");
00133   free(data);
00134 };
00135 
00136 
00137 /**
00138  * \brief main
00139  *
00140  * \description
00141  *  Example of using some of the elemdeath module and related calls.
00142  *  Loops through 4 different cases of dead elements in a 3x3 hex mesh
00143  *  and shows how to find various topological information about the
00144  *  dead element regions wrt the mesh sides.
00145  *
00146  */
00147 int main(void){
00148   FC_ReturnCode rc;
00149   int i,j;
00150   FC_Dataset dataset;
00151   FC_Mesh mesh;
00152 
00153   //coord info for the mesh
00154   FC_Coords lowers = { 0., 0., 0. };
00155   FC_Coords uppers = { 1., 1., 0.5 };
00156   int numElemPerType = 27;
00157 
00158   FC_VerbosityLevel verbose_level = FC_QUIET;
00159 
00160   int numMeshShapes;
00161   FC_Shape* meshShapes;
00162   FC_Subset meshskin;
00163 
00164    // init library and load dataset
00165   rc = fc_setLibraryVerbosity(verbose_level);
00166   fc_exitIfError(rc);
00167   rc = fc_initLibrary();
00168   fc_exitIfError(rc);
00169 
00170   // setup - create test mesh
00171   rc = fc_createDataset("dset", &dataset);
00172   fc_exitIfErrorPrintf(rc,"abort: failed to create dataset");
00173 
00174   rc = fc_createSimpleHexMesh(dataset,"hex_mesh",3,3,3,lowers,uppers,&mesh);
00175   fc_exitIfErrorPrintf(rc, "abort: failed to creat mesh");
00176 
00177   rc = fc_getMeshShapes(mesh,30,0,&numMeshShapes,
00178                    &meshShapes);
00179   fc_exitIfErrorPrintf(rc, "failed to getMeshShapes");
00180 
00181   for (i = 0; i < numMeshShapes; i++){
00182     fc_printShape(&meshShapes[i],"",0);
00183   }
00184   //we know there is only 1 mesh shape
00185   if (numMeshShapes != 1){
00186     fc_printfErrorMessage("There should only be 1 mesh shape");
00187     exit(-1);
00188   }
00189 
00190   //now get the skin (could also get this by merging the meshSideFaces)
00191   //becuase we will be looking at decayed mesh skin segments
00192   rc= fc_getMeshSkin(mesh,&meshskin);
00193   if (rc != FC_SUCCESS){
00194     fc_printfErrorMessage("cant get mesh skin");
00195     exit(1);
00196   }
00197 
00198   printf("-------------------------------------------------------------\n");
00199   
00200   //now try 4 different dead cases:
00201   for (i = 0 ; i < 4; i++){
00202     int numdeadregions;
00203     FC_Variable deadvar;
00204     FC_Subset deadsubset,*deadregions; 
00205 
00206     //set the dead elements
00207     makeDeadVar(mesh,i,numElemPerType,&deadvar);
00208     
00209     //now get dead subset
00210     rc = fc_createThresholdSubset(deadvar,"=",1,"temp_dead", &deadsubset);
00211     fc_exitIfErrorPrintf(rc, "failed to create dead subset");
00212     fc_deleteVariable(deadvar);
00213     
00214     //segment it by connectivity in case its not contiguous
00215     //to get the dead regions
00216     rc = fc_segment(deadsubset,1,&numdeadregions,&deadregions);
00217     fc_exitIfErrorPrintf(rc, "failed to segment dead subset");
00218     fc_deleteSubset(deadsubset);
00219     
00220     if (numdeadregions  == 1){
00221       printf("There is 1 dead region:\n");
00222     }else {
00223       printf("There are %d dead regions:\n",numdeadregions);
00224     }
00225     fflush(NULL);
00226 
00227     //for each dead region, see what surfaces of each meshshape
00228     //it intersects with
00229     for (j = 0; j < numdeadregions; j++){
00230       FC_Subset *decayedMeshSkin_seg; // segments the intersection of
00231                                       // the dead region with the mesh skin
00232       int numdecayedseg; //number of the above
00233       FC_Subset deadskin;
00234       int** decayflags;
00235       int l,ll,lll,llll;
00236 
00237       //note - may change later what im doing here, in face maybe
00238       //shapeDeath may become this example
00239       //segment the intersection of the dead region with the mesh skin
00240       rc = fc_getDecayedSkin(deadregions[j],&meshskin,&deadskin);
00241       fc_exitIfErrorPrintf(rc, "failed to get decayed skin");
00242       if (FC_HANDLE_EQUIV(deadskin,FC_NULL_SUBSET)){
00243      numdecayedseg = 0;
00244       }else{
00245      rc = fc_segment(deadskin,1,&numdecayedseg,&decayedMeshSkin_seg);
00246      fc_exitIfErrorPrintf(rc, "failed to get decayed mesh skin segments");
00247      fc_deleteSubset(deadskin);
00248       }
00249 
00250       decayflags = (int**)malloc(numdecayedseg*sizeof(int*));
00251       if (decayflags == NULL){
00252      fc_printfErrorMessage("MEMORY ERROR\n");
00253      exit(-1);
00254       }
00255                      
00256       //for each dead segment get which mesh part sides it intersects
00257       printf("DeadRegion %d intersects the Mesh surface in ",j);
00258       printf("%d decayedMeshSkin segments\n", numdecayedseg);
00259       for (l = 0; l < numdecayedseg; l++){
00260      int count;
00261      //   fc_printSubset(decayedMeshSkin_seg[l],"",0);
00262      rc = fc_getShapeSidesDecayType(decayedMeshSkin_seg[l],
00263                            &meshShapes[0],
00264                      &decayflags[l]);
00265      fc_exitIfErrorPrintf(rc, "failed to get sides decay");
00266      
00267      count = 0;
00268      printf("Segment %d sides decay: ", l);
00269      for(ll = 0; ll < meshShapes[0].numSides;ll++){
00270        if (decayflags[l][ll] == 1 ){
00271          printf("%d ",ll);
00272          count++;
00273        }
00274      }
00275      if (!count) printf("none");
00276      printf("\n");
00277 
00278      count = 0;
00279      printf("Segment %d sides erosion: ", l);
00280      for(ll = 0; ll < meshShapes[0].numSides;ll++){
00281        if (decayflags[l][ll] == 2){
00282          printf("%d ",ll);
00283          count++;
00284        }
00285      }
00286      if (!count) printf("none");
00287      printf("\n");
00288       }
00289 
00290       for (l = 0; l < numdecayedseg; l++){
00291      fc_deleteSubset(decayedMeshSkin_seg[l]);
00292       }
00293       free(decayedMeshSkin_seg);
00294 
00295       //check the sides decay flag against the side adjacencies
00296       for (l = 0; l < numdecayedseg; l++){
00297      for (ll = l+1; ll < numdecayedseg ; ll++){
00298        for(lll = 0; lll < meshShapes[0].numSides; lll++){
00299          for(llll = 0; llll < meshShapes[0].numSides; llll++){
00300            if (lll != llll){
00301           // printf("comparing flags[%d][%d] flags[%d][%d]\n",
00302           //      l,lll,ll,llll);
00303           if (decayflags[l][lll] == 1  && decayflags[ll][llll] == 1 &&
00304               meshShapes[l].adjmatrix[lll][llll] == 0){
00305             printf("Deadregion %d intersects the mesh in non-adjacent sides: %d %d\n",j,lll,llll);
00306           }
00307            }
00308          }
00309        }
00310      }
00311       }
00312       
00313       //clean up
00314       for(l = 0; l < numdecayedseg; l++){
00315      free(decayflags[l]);
00316       }
00317       free(decayflags);
00318 
00319       fc_deleteSubset(deadregions[j]);
00320     } // j - dead regions
00321     printf("\n");
00322     free(deadregions);
00323   }//k - cases
00324 
00325   //clean up
00326   for(i = 0; i < numMeshShapes; i++){
00327     fc_freeShape(&meshShapes[i]);
00328   }
00329   free(meshShapes);
00330 
00331   fc_deleteMesh(mesh);
00332   fc_deleteSubset(meshskin);
00333   
00334   return 1;
00335 }
